admin_password.title: Custom password for admin user. Defaults to random string. This must be set only when a new service is being created.
admin_password.user_error: Must consist of alpha-numeric characters, underscores or dashes

admin_username.title: Custom username for admin user. This must be set only when a new service is being created.
admin_username.user_error: Must consist of alpha-numeric characters, dots, underscores or dashes, may not start with dash or dot, max 64 characters

automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.title: Automatic utility network IP Filter
automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.description: Automatically allow connections from servers in the utility network within the same zone

backup_hour.title: The hour of day (in UTC) when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

backup_minute.title: The minute of an hour when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

binlog_retention_period.title: The minimum amount of time in seconds to keep binlog entries before deletion. This may be extended for services that require binlog entries for longer than the default for example if using the MySQL Debezium Kafka connector.

connect_timeout.title: connect_timeout
connect_timeout.description: The number of seconds that the mysqld server waits for a connect packet before responding with Bad handshake

default_time_zone.title: default_time_zone
default_time_zone.description: Default server time zone as an offset from UTC (from -12:00 to +12:00), a time zone name, or 'SYSTEM' to use the MySQL server default.

group_concat_max_len.title: group_concat_max_len
group_concat_max_len.description: The maximum permitted result length in bytes for the GROUP_CONCAT() function.

information_schema_stats_expiry.title: information_schema_stats_expiry
information_schema_stats_expiry.description: The time, in seconds, before cached statistics expire

innodb_change_buffer_max_size.title: innodb_change_buffer_max_size
innodb_change_buffer_max_size.description: Maximum size for the InnoDB change buffer, as a percentage of the total size of the buffer pool. Default is 25

innodb_flush_neighbors.title: innodb_flush_neighbors
innodb_flush_neighbors.description: Specifies whether flushing a page from the InnoDB buffer pool also flushes other dirty pages in the same extent (default is 1): 0 - dirty pages in the same extent are not flushed, 1 - flush contiguous dirty pages in the same extent, 2 - flush dirty pages in the same extent

innodb_ft_min_token_size.title: innodb_ft_min_token_size
innodb_ft_min_token_size.description: Minimum length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index. Changing this parameter will lead to a restart of the MySQL service.

innodb_ft_server_stopword_table.title: innodb_ft_server_stopword_table
innodb_ft_server_stopword_table.description: This option is used to specify your own InnoDB FULLTEXT index stopword list for all InnoDB tables.

innodb_lock_wait_timeout.title: innodb_lock_wait_timeout
innodb_lock_wait_timeout.description: The length of time in seconds an InnoDB transaction waits for a row lock before giving up. Default is 120.

innodb_log_buffer_size.title: innodb_log_buffer_size
innodb_log_buffer_size.description: The size in bytes of the buffer that InnoDB uses to write to the log files on disk.

innodb_online_alter_log_max_size.title: innodb_online_alter_log_max_size
innodb_online_alter_log_max_size.description: The upper limit in bytes on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables.

innodb_print_all_deadlocks.title: innodb_print_all_deadlocks
innodb_print_all_deadlocks.description: When enabled, information about all deadlocks in InnoDB user transactions is recorded in the error log. Disabled by default.

innodb_read_io_threads.title: innodb_read_io_threads
innodb_read_io_threads.description: The number of I/O threads for read operations in InnoDB. Default is 4. Changing this parameter will lead to a restart of the MySQL service.

innodb_rollback_on_timeout.title: innodb_rollback_on_timeout
innodb_rollback_on_timeout.description: When enabled a transaction timeout causes InnoDB to abort and roll back the entire transaction. Changing this parameter will lead to a restart of the MySQL service.

innodb_thread_concurrency.title: innodb_thread_concurrency
innodb_thread_concurrency.description: Defines the maximum number of threads permitted inside of InnoDB. Default is 0 (infinite concurrency - no limit)

innodb_write_io_threads.title: innodb_write_io_threads
innodb_write_io_threads.description: The number of I/O threads for write operations in InnoDB. Default is 4. Changing this parameter will lead to a restart of the MySQL service.

interactive_timeout.title: interactive_timeout
interactive_timeout.description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.

internal_tmp_mem_storage_engine.title: internal_tmp_mem_storage_engine
internal_tmp_mem_storage_engine.description: The storage engine for in-memory internal temporary tables.

ip_filter.title: IP filter
ip_filter.description: Allow incoming connections from CIDR address block, e.g. '10.20.0.0/16'

long_query_time.title: long_query_time
long_query_time.description: The slow_query_logs work as SQL statements that take more than long_query_time seconds to execute. Default is 10s

max_allowed_packet.title: max_allowed_packet
max_allowed_packet.description: Size of the largest message in bytes that can be received by the server. Default is 67108864 (64M)

max_heap_table_size.title: max_heap_table_size
max_heap_table_size.description: Limits the size of internal in-memory tables. Also set tmp_table_size. Default is 16777216 (16M)

dbname.title: Database name for bootstrapping the initial connection

host.title: Hostname or IP address of the server where to migrate data from

ignore_dbs.title: Comma-separated list of databases, which should be ignored during migration (supported by MySQL and PostgreSQL only at the moment)

method.title: The migration method to be used (currently supported only by Redis, Dragonfly, MySQL and PostgreSQL service types)

password.title: Password for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

port.title: Port number of the server where to migrate data from

ssl.title: The server where to migrate data from is secured with SSL

username.title: User name for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

net_buffer_length.title: net_buffer_length
net_buffer_length.description: Start sizes of connection buffer and result buffer. Default is 16384 (16K). Changing this parameter will lead to a restart of the MySQL service.

net_read_timeout.title: net_read_timeout
net_read_timeout.description: The number of seconds to wait for more data from a connection before aborting the read.

net_write_timeout.title: net_write_timeout
net_write_timeout.description: The number of seconds to wait for a block to be written to a connection before aborting the write.

public_access.title: Public Access
public_access.description: Allow access to the service from the public Internet

service_log.title: Service logging
service_log.description: Store logs for the service so that they are available in the HTTP API and console.

slow_query_log.title: slow_query_log
slow_query_log.description: Slow query log enables capturing of slow queries. Setting slow_query_log to false also truncates the mysql.slow_log table. Default is off

sort_buffer_size.title: sort_buffer_size
sort_buffer_size.description: Sort buffer size in bytes for ORDER BY optimization. Default is 262144 (256K)

sql_mode.title: sql_mode
sql_mode.description: Global SQL mode. Set to empty to use MySQL server defaults. When creating a new service and not setting this field Aiven default SQL mode (strict, SQL standard compliant) will be assigned.
sql_mode.user_error: Must be uppercase alphabetic characters, underscores and commas

sql_require_primary_key.title: sql_require_primary_key
sql_require_primary_key.description: Require primary key to be defined for new tables or old tables modified with ALTER TABLE and fail if missing. It is recommended to always have primary keys because various functionality may break if any large table is missing them.

tmp_table_size.title: tmp_table_size
tmp_table_size.description: Limits the size of internal in-memory tables. Also set max_heap_table_size. Default is 16777216 (16M)

wait_timeout.title: wait_timeout
wait_timeout.description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a noninteractive connection before closing it.

action_auto_create_index_enabled.title: action.auto_create_index
action_auto_create_index_enabled.description: Explicitly allow or block automatic creation of indices. Defaults to true

action_destructive_requires_name.title: Require explicit index names when deleting

allowed_tries.title: internal_authentication_backend_limiting.allowed_tries
allowed_tries.description: The number of login attempts allowed before login is blocked

block_expiry_seconds.title: internal_authentication_backend_limiting.block_expiry_seconds
block_expiry_seconds.description: The duration of time that login remains blocked after a failed login

max_blocked_clients.title: internal_authentication_backend_limiting.max_blocked_clients
max_blocked_clients.description: The maximum number of blocked IP addresses

max_tracked_clients.title: internal_authentication_backend_limiting.max_tracked_clients
max_tracked_clients.description: The maximum number of tracked IP addresses that have failed login

time_window_seconds.title: internal_authentication_backend_limiting.time_window_seconds
time_window_seconds.description: The window of time in which the value for `allowed_tries` is enforced

allowed_tries.title: ip_rate_limiting.allowed_tries
allowed_tries.description: The number of login attempts allowed before login is blocked

block_expiry_seconds.title: ip_rate_limiting.block_expiry_seconds
block_expiry_seconds.description: The duration of time that login remains blocked after a failed login

max_blocked_clients.title: ip_rate_limiting.max_blocked_clients
max_blocked_clients.description: The maximum number of blocked IP addresses

max_tracked_clients.title: ip_rate_limiting.max_tracked_clients
max_tracked_clients.description: The maximum number of tracked IP addresses that have failed login

time_window_seconds.title: ip_rate_limiting.time_window_seconds
time_window_seconds.description: The window of time in which the value for `allowed_tries` is enforced

automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.title: Automatic utility network IP Filter
automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.description: Automatically allow connections from servers in the utility network within the same zone

cluster_max_shards_per_node.title: cluster.max_shards_per_node
cluster_max_shards_per_node.description: Controls the number of shards allowed in the cluster per data node

cluster_routing_allocation_node_concurre.title: Concurrent incoming/outgoing shard recoveries per node
cluster_routing_allocation_node_concurre.description: How many concurrent incoming/outgoing shard recoveries (normally replicas) are allowed to happen on a node. Defaults to 2.

custom_domain.title: Custom domain
custom_domain.description: Serve the web frontend using a custom CNAME pointing to the Aiven DNS name

email_sender_name.title: Sender name placeholder to be used in Opensearch Dashboards and Opensearch keystore
email_sender_name.description: This should be identical to the Sender name defined in Opensearch dashboards
email_sender_name.user_error: Must consist of lower-case alpha-numeric characters and dashes, max 40 characters

email_sender_password.title: Sender password for Opensearch alerts to authenticate with SMTP server
email_sender_password.description: Sender password for Opensearch alerts to authenticate with SMTP server

http_max_content_length.title: http.max_content_length
http_max_content_length.description: Maximum content length for HTTP requests to the OpenSearch HTTP API, in bytes.

http_max_header_size.title: http.max_header_size
http_max_header_size.description: The max size of allowed headers, in bytes

http_max_initial_line_length.title: http.max_initial_line_length
http_max_initial_line_length.description: The max length of an HTTP URL, in bytes

index_template.title: Template settings for all new indexes

mapping_nested_objects_limit.title: index.mapping.nested_objects.limit
mapping_nested_objects_limit.description: The maximum number of nested JSON objects that a single document can contain across all nested types. This limit helps to prevent out of memory errors when a document contains too many nested objects. Default is 10000.

number_of_replicas.title: index.number_of_replicas
number_of_replicas.description: The number of replicas each primary shard has.

number_of_shards.title: index.number_of_shards
number_of_shards.description: The number of primary shards that an index should have.

indices_fielddata_cache_size.title: indices.fielddata.cache.size
indices_fielddata_cache_size.description: Relative amount. Maximum amount of heap memory used for field data cache. This is an expert setting; decreasing the value too much will increase overhead of loading field data; too much memory used for field data cache will decrease amount of heap available for other operations.

indices_memory_index_buffer_size.title: indices.memory.index_buffer_size
indices_memory_index_buffer_size.description: Percentage value. Default is 10%. Total amount of heap used for indexing buffer, before writing segments to disk. This is an expert setting. Too low value will slow down indexing; too high value will increase indexing performance but causes performance issues for query performance.

indices_memory_max_index_buffer_size.title: indices.memory.max_index_buffer_size
indices_memory_max_index_buffer_size.description: Absolute value. Default is unbound. Doesn't work without indices.memory.index_buffer_size. Maximum amount of heap used for query cache, an absolute indices.memory.index_buffer_size maximum hard limit.

indices_memory_min_index_buffer_size.title: indices.memory.min_index_buffer_size
indices_memory_min_index_buffer_size.description: Absolute value. Default is 48mb. Doesn't work without indices.memory.index_buffer_size. Minimum amount of heap used for query cache, an absolute indices.memory.index_buffer_size minimal hard limit.

indices_queries_cache_size.title: indices.queries.cache.size
indices_queries_cache_size.description: Percentage value. Default is 10%. Maximum amount of heap used for query cache. This is an expert setting. Too low value will decrease query performance and increase performance for other operations; too high value will cause issues with other OpenSearch functionality.

indices_query_bool_max_clause_count.title: indices.query.bool.max_clause_count
indices_query_bool_max_clause_count.description: Maximum number of clauses Lucene BooleanQuery can have. The default value (1024) is relatively high, and increasing it may cause performance issues. Investigate other approaches first before increasing this value.

indices_recovery_max_bytes_per_sec.title: indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec
indices_recovery_max_bytes_per_sec.description: Limits total inbound and outbound recovery traffic for each node. Applies to both peer recoveries as well as snapshot recoveries (i.e., restores from a snapshot). Defaults to 40mb

indices_recovery_max_concurrent_file_chu.title: indices.recovery.max_concurrent_file_chunks
indices_recovery_max_concurrent_file_chu.description: Number of file chunks sent in parallel for each recovery. Defaults to 2.

ip_filter.title: IP filter
ip_filter.description: Allow incoming connections from CIDR address block, e.g. '10.20.0.0/16'

ism_enabled.title: Specifies whether ISM is enabled or not

ism_history_enabled.title: Specifies whether audit history is enabled or not. The logs from ISM are automatically indexed to a logs document.

ism_history_max_age.title: The maximum age before rolling over the audit history index in hours

ism_history_max_docs.title: The maximum number of documents before rolling over the audit history index.

ism_history_rollover_check_period.title: The time between rollover checks for the audit history index in hours.

ism_history_rollover_retention_period.title: How long audit history indices are kept in days.

keep_index_refresh_interval.title: Don't reset index.refresh_interval to the default value
keep_index_refresh_interval.description: Aiven automation resets index.refresh_interval to default value for every index to be sure that indices are always visible to search. If it doesn't fit your case, you can disable this by setting up this flag to true.

client_id.title: The ID of the OpenID Connect client
client_id.description: The ID of the OpenID Connect client configured in your IdP. Required.

client_secret.title: The client secret of the OpenID Connect
client_secret.description: The client secret of the OpenID Connect client configured in your IdP. Required.

connect_url.title: OpenID Connect metadata/configuration URL
connect_url.description: The URL of your IdP where the Security plugin can find the OpenID Connect metadata/configuration settings.

enabled.title: Enable or disable OpenSearch OpenID Connect authentication
enabled.description: Enables or disables OpenID Connect authentication for OpenSearch. When enabled, users can authenticate using OpenID Connect with an Identity Provider.

header.title: HTTP header name of the JWT token
header.description: HTTP header name of the JWT token. Optional. Default is Authorization.

jwt_header.title: The HTTP header that stores the token
jwt_header.description: The HTTP header that stores the token. Typically the Authorization header with the Bearer schema: Authorization: Bearer <token>. Optional. Default is Authorization.

jwt_url_parameter.title: URL JWT token.
jwt_url_parameter.description: If the token is not transmitted in the HTTP header, but as an URL parameter, define the name of the parameter here. Optional.

refresh_rate_limit_count.title: The maximum number of unknown key IDs in the time frame
refresh_rate_limit_count.description: The maximum number of unknown key IDs in the time frame. Default is 10. Optional.

refresh_rate_limit_time_window_ms.title: The time frame to use when checking the maximum number of unknown key IDs, in milliseconds
refresh_rate_limit_time_window_ms.description: The time frame to use when checking the maximum number of unknown key IDs, in milliseconds. Optional.Default is 10000 (10 seconds).

roles_key.title: The key in the JSON payload that stores the user’s roles
roles_key.description: The key in the JSON payload that stores the user’s roles. The value of this key must be a comma-separated list of roles. Required only if you want to use roles in the JWT

scope.title: The scope of the identity token issued by the IdP
scope.description: The scope of the identity token issued by the IdP. Optional. Default is openid profile email address phone.

subject_key.title: The key in the JSON payload that stores the user’s name
subject_key.description: The key in the JSON payload that stores the user’s name. If not defined, the subject registered claim is used. Most IdP providers use the preferred_username claim. Optional.

max_old_space_size.title: max_old_space_size
max_old_space_size.description: Limits the maximum amount of memory (in MiB) the OpenSearch Dashboards process can use. This sets the max_old_space_size option of the nodejs running the OpenSearch Dashboards. Note: the memory reserved by OpenSearch Dashboards is not available for OpenSearch.

opensearch_request_timeout.title: Timeout in milliseconds for requests made by OpenSearch Dashboards towards OpenSearch

override_main_response_version.title: compatibility.override_main_response_version
override_main_response_version.description: Compatibility mode sets OpenSearch to report its version as 7.10 so clients continue to work. Default is false

plugins_alerting_filter_by_backend_roles.title: plugins.alerting.filter_by_backend_roles
plugins_alerting_filter_by_backend_roles.description: Enable or disable filtering of alerting by backend roles. Requires Security plugin. Defaults to false

public_access.title: Public Access
public_access.description: Allow access to the service from the public Internet

reindex_remote_whitelist.title: reindex_remote_whitelist
reindex_remote_whitelist.description: Whitelisted addresses for reindexing. Changing this value will cause all OpenSearch instances to restart.

enabled.title: Enable or disable OpenSearch SAML authentication
enabled.description: Enables or disables SAML-based authentication for OpenSearch. When enabled, users can authenticate using SAML with an Identity Provider.

idp_entity_id.title: Identity Provider Entity ID
idp_entity_id.description: The unique identifier for the Identity Provider (IdP) entity that is used for SAML authentication. This value is typically provided by the IdP.

idp_metadata_url.title: Identity Provider (IdP) SAML metadata URL
idp_metadata_url.description: The URL of the SAML metadata for the Identity Provider (IdP). This is used to configure SAML-based authentication with the IdP.

idp_pemtrustedcas_content.title: PEM-encoded root CA Content for SAML IdP server verification
idp_pemtrustedcas_content.description: This parameter specifies the PEM-encoded root certificate authority (CA) content for the SAML identity provider (IdP) server verification. The root CA content is used to verify the SSL/TLS certificate presented by the server.

roles_key.title: SAML response role attribute
roles_key.description: Optional. Specifies the attribute in the SAML response where role information is stored, if available. Role attributes are not required for SAML authentication, but can be included in SAML assertions by most Identity Providers (IdPs) to determine user access levels or permissions.

sp_entity_id.title: Service Provider Entity ID
sp_entity_id.description: The unique identifier for the Service Provider (SP) entity that is used for SAML authentication. This value is typically provided by the SP.

subject_key.title: SAML response subject attribute
subject_key.description: Optional. Specifies the attribute in the SAML response where the subject identifier is stored. If not configured, the NameID attribute is used by default.

script_max_compilations_rate.title: Script max compilation rate - circuit breaker to prevent/minimize OOMs
script_max_compilations_rate.description: Script compilation circuit breaker limits the number of inline script compilations within a period of time. Default is use-context

search_max_buckets.title: search.max_buckets
search_max_buckets.description: Maximum number of aggregation buckets allowed in a single response. OpenSearch default value is used when this is not defined.

service_log.title: Service logging
service_log.description: Store logs for the service so that they are available in the HTTP API and console.

thread_pool_analyze_queue_size.title: analyze thread pool queue size
thread_pool_analyze_queue_size.description: Size for the thread pool queue. See documentation for exact details.

thread_pool_analyze_size.title: analyze thread pool size
thread_pool_analyze_size.description: Size for the thread pool. See documentation for exact details. Do note this may have maximum value depending on CPU count - value is automatically lowered if set to higher than maximum value.

thread_pool_force_merge_size.title: force_merge thread pool size
thread_pool_force_merge_size.description: Size for the thread pool. See documentation for exact details. Do note this may have maximum value depending on CPU count - value is automatically lowered if set to higher than maximum value.

thread_pool_get_queue_size.title: get thread pool queue size
thread_pool_get_queue_size.description: Size for the thread pool queue. See documentation for exact details.

thread_pool_get_size.title: get thread pool size
thread_pool_get_size.description: Size for the thread pool. See documentation for exact details. Do note this may have maximum value depending on CPU count - value is automatically lowered if set to higher than maximum value.

thread_pool_search_queue_size.title: search thread pool queue size
thread_pool_search_queue_size.description: Size for the thread pool queue. See documentation for exact details.

thread_pool_search_size.title: search thread pool size
thread_pool_search_size.description: Size for the thread pool. See documentation for exact details. Do note this may have maximum value depending on CPU count - value is automatically lowered if set to higher than maximum value.

thread_pool_search_throttled_queue_size.title: search_throttled thread pool queue size
thread_pool_search_throttled_queue_size.description: Size for the thread pool queue. See documentation for exact details.

thread_pool_search_throttled_size.title: search_throttled thread pool size
thread_pool_search_throttled_size.description: Size for the thread pool. See documentation for exact details. Do note this may have maximum value depending on CPU count - value is automatically lowered if set to higher than maximum value.

thread_pool_write_queue_size.title: write thread pool queue size
thread_pool_write_queue_size.description: Size for the thread pool queue. See documentation for exact details.

thread_pool_write_size.title: write thread pool size
thread_pool_write_size.description: Size for the thread pool. See documentation for exact details. Do note this may have maximum value depending on CPU count - value is automatically lowered if set to higher than maximum value.

admin_password.title: Custom password for admin user. Defaults to random string. This must be set only when a new service is being created.
admin_password.user_error: Must consist of alpha-numeric characters, underscores or dashes

admin_username.title: Custom username for admin user. This must be set only when a new service is being created.
admin_username.user_error: Must consist of alpha-numeric characters, dots, underscores or dashes, may not start with dash or dot, max 64 characters

automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.title: Automatic utility network IP Filter
automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.description: Automatically allow connections from servers in the utility network within the same zone

autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor.title: autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor
autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor.description: Specifies a fraction of the table size to add to autovacuum_analyze_threshold when deciding whether to trigger an ANALYZE. The default is 0.2 (20% of table size)

autovacuum_analyze_threshold.title: autovacuum_analyze_threshold
autovacuum_analyze_threshold.description: Specifies the minimum number of inserted, updated or deleted tuples needed to trigger an ANALYZE in any one table. The default is 50 tuples.

autovacuum_freeze_max_age.title: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
autovacuum_freeze_max_age.description: Specifies the maximum age (in transactions) that a table's pg_class.relfrozenxid field can attain before a VACUUM operation is forced to prevent transaction ID wraparound within the table. Note that the system will launch autovacuum processes to prevent wraparound even when autovacuum is otherwise disabled. This parameter will cause the server to be restarted.

autovacuum_max_workers.title: autovacuum_max_workers
autovacuum_max_workers.description: Specifies the maximum number of autovacuum processes (other than the autovacuum launcher) that may be running at any one time. The default is three. This parameter can only be set at server start.

autovacuum_naptime.title: autovacuum_naptime
autovacuum_naptime.description: Specifies the minimum delay between autovacuum runs on any given database. The delay is measured in seconds, and the default is one minute

autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay.title: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay
autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay.description: Specifies the cost delay value that will be used in automatic VACUUM operations. If -1 is specified, the regular vacuum_cost_delay value will be used. The default value is 20 milliseconds

autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit.title: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit
autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit.description: Specifies the cost limit value that will be used in automatic VACUUM operations. If -1 is specified (which is the default), the regular vacuum_cost_limit value will be used.

autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor.title: autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor
autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor.description: Specifies a fraction of the table size to add to autovacuum_vacuum_threshold when deciding whether to trigger a VACUUM. The default is 0.2 (20% of table size)

autovacuum_vacuum_threshold.title: autovacuum_vacuum_threshold
autovacuum_vacuum_threshold.description: Specifies the minimum number of updated or deleted tuples needed to trigger a VACUUM in any one table. The default is 50 tuples

backup_hour.title: The hour of day (in UTC) when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

backup_minute.title: The minute of an hour when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

bgwriter_delay.title: bgwriter_delay
bgwriter_delay.description: Specifies the delay between activity rounds for the background writer in milliseconds. Default is 200.

bgwriter_flush_after.title: bgwriter_flush_after
bgwriter_flush_after.description: Whenever more than bgwriter_flush_after bytes have been written by the background writer, attempt to force the OS to issue these writes to the underlying storage. Specified in kilobytes, default is 512. Setting of 0 disables forced writeback.

bgwriter_lru_maxpages.title: bgwriter_lru_maxpages
bgwriter_lru_maxpages.description: In each round, no more than this many buffers will be written by the background writer. Setting this to zero disables background writing. Default is 100.

bgwriter_lru_multiplier.title: bgwriter_lru_multiplier
bgwriter_lru_multiplier.description: The average recent need for new buffers is multiplied by bgwriter_lru_multiplier to arrive at an estimate of the number that will be needed during the next round, (up to bgwriter_lru_maxpages). 1.0 represents a “just in time” policy of writing exactly the number of buffers predicted to be needed. Larger values provide some cushion against spikes in demand, while smaller values intentionally leave writes to be done by server processes. The default is 2.0.

deadlock_timeout.title: deadlock_timeout
deadlock_timeout.description: This is the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait on a lock before checking to see if there is a deadlock condition.

default_toast_compression.title: default_toast_compression
default_toast_compression.description: Specifies the default TOAST compression method for values of compressible columns (the default is lz4).

idle_in_transaction_session_timeout.title: idle_in_transaction_session_timeout
idle_in_transaction_session_timeout.description: Time out sessions with open transactions after this number of milliseconds

ip_filter.title: IP filter
ip_filter.description: Allow incoming connections from CIDR address block, e.g. '10.20.0.0/16'

jit.title: jit
jit.description: Controls system-wide use of Just-in-Time Compilation (JIT).

log_autovacuum_min_duration.title: log_autovacuum_min_duration
log_autovacuum_min_duration.description: Causes each action executed by autovacuum to be logged if it ran for at least the specified number of milliseconds. Setting this to zero logs all autovacuum actions. Minus-one (the default) disables logging autovacuum actions.

log_error_verbosity.title: log_error_verbosity
log_error_verbosity.description: Controls the amount of detail written in the server log for each message that is logged.

log_line_prefix.title: log_line_prefix
log_line_prefix.description: Choose from one of the available log-formats. These can support popular log analyzers like pgbadger, pganalyze etc.

log_min_duration_statement.title: log_min_duration_statement
log_min_duration_statement.description: Log statements that take more than this number of milliseconds to run, -1 disables

log_temp_files.title: log_temp_files
log_temp_files.description: Log statements for each temporary file created larger than this number of kilobytes, -1 disables

max_files_per_process.title: max_files_per_process
max_files_per_process.description: PostgreSQL maximum number of files that can be open per process

max_logical_replication_workers.title: max_logical_replication_workers
max_logical_replication_workers.description: PostgreSQL maximum logical replication workers (taken from the pool of max_parallel_workers)

max_parallel_workers.title: max_parallel_workers
max_parallel_workers.description: Sets the maximum number of workers that the system can support for parallel queries

max_parallel_workers_per_gather.title: max_parallel_workers_per_gather
max_parallel_workers_per_gather.description: Sets the maximum number of workers that can be started by a single Gather or Gather Merge node

max_pred_locks_per_transaction.title: max_pred_locks_per_transaction
max_pred_locks_per_transaction.description: PostgreSQL maximum predicate locks per transaction

max_slot_wal_keep_size.title: max_slot_wal_keep_size
max_slot_wal_keep_size.description: PostgreSQL maximum WAL size (MB) reserved for replication slots. Default is -1 (unlimited). wal_keep_size minimum WAL size setting takes precedence over this.

max_stack_depth.title: max_stack_depth
max_stack_depth.description: Maximum depth of the stack in bytes

max_standby_archive_delay.title: max_standby_archive_delay
max_standby_archive_delay.description: Max standby archive delay in milliseconds

max_standby_streaming_delay.title: max_standby_streaming_delay
max_standby_streaming_delay.description: Max standby streaming delay in milliseconds

max_worker_processes.title: max_worker_processes
max_worker_processes.description: Sets the maximum number of background processes that the system can support

dbname.title: Database name for bootstrapping the initial connection

host.title: Hostname or IP address of the server where to migrate data from

ignore_dbs.title: Comma-separated list of databases, which should be ignored during migration (supported by MySQL and PostgreSQL only at the moment)

method.title: The migration method to be used (currently supported only by Redis, Dragonfly, MySQL and PostgreSQL service types)

password.title: Password for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

port.title: Port number of the server where to migrate data from

ssl.title: The server where to migrate data from is secured with SSL

username.title: User name for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

pg_partman_bgw_interval.title: pg_partman_bgw.interval
pg_partman_bgw_interval.description: Sets the time interval to run pg_partman's scheduled tasks

pg_partman_bgw_role.title: pg_partman_bgw.role
pg_partman_bgw_role.description: Controls which role to use for pg_partman's scheduled background tasks.
pg_partman_bgw_role.user_error: Must consist of alpha-numeric characters, dots, underscores or dashes, may not start with dash or dot, max 64 characters

pg_stat_monitor_enable.title: Enable pg_stat_monitor extension if available for the current cluster
pg_stat_monitor_enable.description: Enable the pg_stat_monitor extension. Enabling this extension will cause the cluster to be restarted.When this extension is enabled, pg_stat_statements results for utility commands are unreliable

pg_stat_monitor_pgsm_enable_query_plan.title: pg_stat_monitor.pgsm_enable_query_plan
pg_stat_monitor_pgsm_enable_query_plan.description: Enables or disables query plan monitoring

pg_stat_monitor_pgsm_max_buckets.title: pg_stat_monitor.pgsm_max_buckets
pg_stat_monitor_pgsm_max_buckets.description: Sets the maximum number of buckets

pg_stat_statements_track.title: pg_stat_statements.track
pg_stat_statements_track.description: Controls which statements are counted. Specify top to track top-level statements (those issued directly by clients), all to also track nested statements (such as statements invoked within functions), or none to disable statement statistics collection. The default value is top.

pgaudit.title: PGAudit settings
pgaudit.description: System-wide settings for the pgaudit extension

feature_enabled.title: Enable pgaudit extension.
feature_enabled.description: Enable pgaudit extension. When enabled, pgaudit extension will be automatically installed.Otherwise, extension will be uninstalled but auditing configurations will be preserved.

log.title: Specifies which classes of statements will be logged by session audit logging.

log_catalog.title: Specifies that session logging should be enabled in the casewhere all relations in a statement are in pg_catalog.

log_client.title: Specifies whether log messages will be visible to a client process such as psql.

log_level.title: Specifies the log level that will be used for log entries.

log_max_string_length.title: Crop parameters representation and whole statements if they exceed this threshold. A (default) value of -1 disable the truncation.

log_nested_statements.title: This GUC allows to turn off logging nested statements, that is, statements that are executed as part of another ExecutorRun.

log_parameter.title: Specifies that audit logging should include the parameters that were passed with the statement.

log_parameter_max_size.title: Specifies that parameter values longer than this setting (in bytes) should not be logged, but replaced with <long param suppressed>.

log_relation.title: Specifies whether session audit logging should create a separate log entry for each relation (TABLE, VIEW, etc.) referenced in a SELECT or DML statement.

log_rows.title: Specifies that audit logging should include the rows retrieved or affected by a statement. When enabled the rows field will be included after the parameter field.

log_statement.title: Specifies whether logging will include the statement text and parameters (if enabled).

log_statement_once.title: Specifies whether logging will include the statement text and parameters with the first log entry for a statement/substatement combination or with every entry.

role.title: Specifies the master role to use for object audit logging.

autodb_idle_timeout.title: If the automatically created database pools have been unused this many seconds, they are freed. If 0 then timeout is disabled. [seconds]

autodb_max_db_connections.title: Do not allow more than this many server connections per database (regardless of user). Setting it to 0 means unlimited.

autodb_pool_size.title: If non-zero then create automatically a pool of that size per user when a pool doesn't exist.

ignore_startup_parameters.title: List of parameters to ignore when given in startup packet

min_pool_size.title: Add more server connections to pool if below this number. Improves behavior when usual load comes suddenly back after period of total inactivity. The value is effectively capped at the pool size.

server_idle_timeout.title: If a server connection has been idle more than this many seconds it will be dropped. If 0 then timeout is disabled. [seconds]

server_lifetime.title: The pooler will close an unused server connection that has been connected longer than this. [seconds]

server_reset_query_always.title: Run server_reset_query (DISCARD ALL) in all pooling modes

max_failover_replication_time_lag.title: max_failover_replication_time_lag
max_failover_replication_time_lag.description: Number of seconds of master unavailability before triggering database failover to standby

public_access.title: Public Access
public_access.description: Allow access to the service from the public Internet

service_log.title: Service logging
service_log.description: Store logs for the service so that they are available in the HTTP API and console.

shared_buffers_percentage.title: shared_buffers_percentage
shared_buffers_percentage.description: Percentage of total RAM that the database server uses for shared memory buffers. Valid range is 20-60 (float), which corresponds to 20% - 60%. This setting adjusts the shared_buffers configuration value.

synchronous_replication.title: Synchronous replication type. Note that the service plan also needs to support synchronous replication.

temp_file_limit.title: temp_file_limit
temp_file_limit.description: PostgreSQL temporary file limit in KiB, -1 for unlimited

timescaledb.title: TimescaleDB extension configuration values
timescaledb.description: System-wide settings for the timescaledb extension

max_background_workers.title: timescaledb.max_background_workers
max_background_workers.description: The number of background workers for timescaledb operations. You should configure this setting to the sum of your number of databases and the total number of concurrent background workers you want running at any given point in time.

track_activity_query_size.title: track_activity_query_size
track_activity_query_size.description: Specifies the number of bytes reserved to track the currently executing command for each active session.

track_functions.title: track_functions
track_functions.description: Enables tracking of function call counts and time used.

track_io_timing.title: track_io_timing
track_io_timing.description: Enables timing of database I/O calls. This parameter is off by default, because it will repeatedly query the operating system for the current time, which may cause significant overhead on some platforms.

variant.title: Variant of the PostgreSQL service, may affect the features that are exposed by default

wal_sender_timeout.title: wal_sender_timeout
wal_sender_timeout.description: Terminate replication connections that are inactive for longer than this amount of time, in milliseconds. Setting this value to zero disables the timeout.
wal_sender_timeout.user_error: Must be either 0 or between 5000 and 10800000.

wal_writer_delay.title: wal_writer_delay
wal_writer_delay.description: WAL flush interval in milliseconds. Note that setting this value to lower than the default 200ms may negatively impact performance

work_mem.title: work_mem
work_mem.description: Sets the maximum amount of memory to be used by a query operation (such as a sort or hash table) before writing to temporary disk files, in MB. Default is 1MB + 0.075% of total RAM (up to 32MB).

automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.title: Automatic utility network IP Filter
automatic_utility_network_ip_filter.description: Automatically allow connections from servers in the utility network within the same zone

ip_filter.title: IP filter
ip_filter.description: Allow incoming connections from CIDR address block, e.g. '10.20.0.0/16'

dbname.title: Database name for bootstrapping the initial connection

host.title: Hostname or IP address of the server where to migrate data from

ignore_dbs.title: Comma-separated list of databases, which should be ignored during migration (supported by MySQL and PostgreSQL only at the moment)

method.title: The migration method to be used (currently supported only by Redis, Dragonfly, MySQL and PostgreSQL service types)

password.title: Password for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

port.title: Port number of the server where to migrate data from

ssl.title: The server where to migrate data from is secured with SSL

username.title: User name for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

public_access.title: Public Access
public_access.description: Allow access to the service from the public Internet

redis_acl_channels_default.title: Default ACL for pub/sub channels used when Redis user is created
redis_acl_channels_default.description: Determines default pub/sub channels' ACL for new users if ACL is not supplied. When this option is not defined, all_channels is assumed to keep backward compatibility. This option doesn't affect Redis configuration acl-pubsub-default.

redis_io_threads.title: Redis IO thread count
redis_io_threads.description: Set Redis IO thread count. Changing this will cause a restart of the Redis service.

redis_lfu_decay_time.title: LFU maxmemory-policy counter decay time in minutes

redis_lfu_log_factor.title: Counter logarithm factor for volatile-lfu and allkeys-lfu maxmemory-policies

redis_number_of_databases.title: Number of Redis databases
redis_number_of_databases.description: Set number of Redis databases. Changing this will cause a restart of the Redis service.

redis_persistence.title: Redis persistence
redis_persistence.description: When persistence is 'rdb', Redis does RDB dumps each 10 minutes if any key is changed. Also RDB dumps are done according to backup schedule for backup purposes. When persistence is 'off', no RDB dumps and backups are done, so data can be lost at any moment if service is restarted for any reason, or if service is powered off. Also service can't be forked.

redis_pubsub_client_output_buffer_limit.title: Pub/sub client output buffer hard limit in MB
redis_pubsub_client_output_buffer_limit.description: Set output buffer limit for pub / sub clients in MB. The value is the hard limit, the soft limit is 1/4 of the hard limit. When setting the limit, be mindful of the available memory in the selected service plan.

redis_timeout.title: Redis idle connection timeout in seconds

service_log.title: Service logging
service_log.description: Store logs for the service so that they are available in the HTTP API and console.
